original: Åkerren, Olof Yngve Carl, överläkare, Göteborg, f. 9/6/96 i Umeå av landskamr. Olof Å. o. Gerda Ahlander. G. 21 m. Carin Prytz. Barn: Bengt f. 22, jur. kand., attaché, Bo 25, med. stud., Gunilla 31, Ingrid o. Kerstin 36. — Stud:ex. i Västerås 13’, med. kand. 17, med. lic. 22 o. med. dr 34 i Upps. Aman. o. assist, v. patol. avd. i Upps. 19-20 o. 21-22, e. läk. v. Umeå las. patol. o. med. avd. 23-24, andre resp. förste und :läk. v. Garn rsjukh. i Sthlm med. avd. 24-26, tf. und:läk. v. Allm. barnh. pediatr. klin. sex mån. 26-27, aman. v. pediatr. klin. i Upps. 27-29, därunder tf. överläk. sex mån., aman. v. med. klin. i Upps. 30, e. läk. v. Linköp. las. barnavd. s. å., las :’läk. där 3’1-44, ’skolläk. v. lärov. i Linköp. 32-44, överläk. v. med. avd. å Barnsjukh. i Gbg sed. 44, sjukh. styresman 45, lär. i b ar nav. v. läroanst. f. barnmorskor i Gbg sed. 45. Bat:läk. i Fik res. 23, v. Fik 25-30, i res. sed. 30. Utr. stud:-res. 24, 29 o. 32-33. Skr.: ett 36-tal upps. inom pediatr. o. inv. med.
translated:
Åkerren, Olof Yngve Carl, senior physician, Gothenburg, born on June 9, 1896 in Umeå to district commissioner Olof Å. and Gerda Ahlander. Married on the 21st with Carin Prytz. Children: Bengt born in 1922, LL.B., Attaché, Bo born in 1925, medical student, Gunilla born in 1931, Ingrid and Kerstin born in 1936. 

Education: Graduated from Västerås high school in 1913, obtained a Bachelor's degree in Medicine in 1917, Medical license in 1922, and a Doctorate in Medicine in 1934 from Uppsala. Assistant and assistant doctor at the Pathology department in Uppsala from 1919-1920 and 1921-1922, resident doctor at Umeå Hospital Pathology and Medical department from 1923-1924, junior and senior assistant doctor at the Medical department at Garnison Hospital in Stockholm from 1924-1926, temporary assistant doctor at the General Children's Hospital Pediatric Clinic for six months in 1926-1927, assistant at the Pediatric Clinic in Uppsala from 1927-1929, interim senior physician for six months during that time, assistant at the Medical Clinic in Uppsala in 1930, resident doctor at Linköping hospital children's department the same year, district physician there from 1931-1944, school doctor at the Linköping high school from 1932-1944, senior physician at the Medical department of the Children's Hospital in Gothenburg since 1944, hospital director in 1945, teacher in child nursing at the school for midwives in Gothenburg since 1945. Battalion physician in the Field Ambulance from 1923, with the Field Ambulance from 1925-1930, and in the reserve since 1930. Studied abroad in 1924, 1929, and 1932-1933. Published approximately 36 papers within pediatrics and internal medicine.
